channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road is not fit for purpose, 18th July
item.description:
The entire Gloucester Road from Cheltenham Train Station to the St George's Road junction is a complete disgrace. There are too many potholes to count and the surface is extremely uneven. This is damaging cars and forcing drivers to swerve at the last minute, which can cause collisions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 246, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Multiple street lights out, 18th July
item.description:
Double street lights all along the high street from marks and Spencer up past H&M, this is eight lights. One out, outside of TSB bank, again on high street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 173, High Street, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham

item.title: Pothole expanding in the narrow entrance to Green St as you turn up the hill from the A46 - narrow lane so it’s, 18th July
item.description:
Entrance to Green St - uphill entrance as you turn off the A46. Only a few inches from the main road and hard to miss as it’s a single track lane. Getting larger very quickly.

item.title: Traffic lights, 18th July
item.description:
Shurdington Road/Moorend Park Road going towards Bath Road. Turned green, one car went through then went immediately back to red with no Amber light. Happened on 17/07/2024 approx 7.30pm.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moorend Park Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Drain cover damaged and making incredibly loud clanking sounds whenever a vehicle in the left lane (heading away from Cheltenham) goes over it., 18th July
item.description:
It is on Shurdington rd opposite the layby (which used to be the Junction with Farmfield rd but is now a layby) it's in the left lane (travelling away from Cheltenham) opposite the glass cycle rack and bus stop. It's been going on for a few weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 18th July
item.description:
Willow tree - historical pollard, with sections of tree beginning to collapse. Sections hung up in neighbouring trees over highway. (Damaged Tree)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking visibility on road/junction (Grass/verge) problem, 18th July
item.description:
Dear Sir / Madam, A few years ago now I contacted you via the council about the verges at the entrance to our close because we and other neighbours had been maintaining / mowing it. Now the residence are mainly elderly and we can no longer mow . We were told that you pay Ubico to cut our verges . Unfortunately in the 24 years since the close was built Ubico have not mown these particular verges. I just wish to inform you and seek your approval for introducing wild flowers to a portion of the verge nearest to my house . I have Oxe eye daisies Yellow rattle Knapweed Ragwort Snowdrops Primroses Lilly of the valley To name but a few and have just sprinkled poppy seeds. This verge leads from the entrance to Viburnum close to my house garden. I have taken on the approx 1/3 of the verge nearest to my house.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects -CW10 Potholes problem, 18th July
item.description:
28 day with give an take plus 15 minutes delay boards needed carriageway pothole 300x400x60mm plus x1 NSD (CW10 Pothole)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 30 x 50 x 4 cm hole near the entrance to 3 properties which is difficult to avoid going over with at least one tyre., 18th July
item.description:
The hole is outside the entrance to Tutlands -GL514TY. It is on a no - through road off Whitelands Lane . When driving into or out of the 3 properties around the hole - Tutlands, Restcroft Farm and Stable lodge, you have to try and avoid it but it’s not easy to always Centre the hole between front and back tyres when driving over it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
